passages.text: China (PRC) | China Consumer DPC Dash

DPC reported 1H25 results with sales/ adj. NP up by \(27\% /80\%\) yoy to RMB2.6bn/RMB91m. The high base caused by previously global recordsetting stores has put challenges on its sssg, but sss of its old stores, incl. BJ/SH (mature markets) still achieved positive growth. We think this indicates consumers' recognition of its products & delivery services. Store expansion in new markets & corporate- level margin improvements remain intact. Maintain Buy.

With 190 net new stores opened in 1H25, it reached 1,198 stores ending Jun- 2025. T1 cities accounted for \(41.8\%\) of its revenue mix. Average daily sales (ADS)/ store in 1H25 was RMB12,915, down \(4\%\) yoy. SSSg was \(- 1\%\) in 1H25, due to high base caused by extra- high- sales stores entering into sssg cycle. Carving out the impact of the stores in the post- Dec 2022 new markets, its SSSG still remained positive. In addition, its T1 cities incl. Beijing/Shanghai (mature market) still achieved positive sssg. Store- level Opm was slightly up 0.1ppt to \(14.6\%\) in 1H25, thanks to lower store operating/maintenance and other expenses, despite higher store- level staff cost ratio on accelerated store opening. Adj. EBITDA margin reached \(12.4\%\) in 1H25, up 1ppts, with lower corporate- level expense ratio.

2H25 outlook. Mgmt. maintains the 300 new store opening target in 2025. 1) The high base of global record- setting stores: The difference vs. traditional new store opening is that they achieved pretty high sales the first day in these new cities, with no ramp- up period, thus sssg measure might not be comprehensive enough. Its store count, market share, and margin trend during scaling up with better corporate- level economy of scale are also important. 2) On delivery aggregators' subsidies in 2- 3Q, mgmt. regards them as customer acquisition channels. As a leading chain brand they also get more exposure on these platforms. They will also take the opportunity to convert customers to its own platform, too.

Maintain Buy with new PT at HKD118. We revised up our 25- 27E earnings, forecasts by \(2 - 4\%\) with better corporate- level expense savings, to reflect efficiency gains under an enlarged store network. Our 28E sales were \(2\%\) lower to consider some lingering near- term high base challenge from the extra- high- sales stores. These stores (inaugural stores in new cities) previously broke records in the global system and will gradually normalize with new store additions in respective cities. Having said that, this indicates strong demand & support the accelerated store opening. Our new PT is HKD118, which translates into 69/50/35x 2025/26/27E PE (adj. EPS). Maintain Buy.
Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 6 - 11 of this report. \\* Jefferies Hong Kong Limited

We rate DPC Dash Buy based on its clear store expansion strategy in the growing pizza market in China, with a delivery- centric store format focusing on pizza SKUs and value- for- money pricing. The company has been strengthening Domino's Pizza brand awareness in China with both online/ offline channel presence and loyalty membership programs to achieve its vision of becoming China's No. 1 pizza brand. It targets to open 300 net new stores in 2025 and 350 each in 2026E.
Downside risks to our price target include lower- than- expected SSsG and store expansion and competition from other QSR brands.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View
Adjusted EBITDA growth of \(32 / 26 / 29\%\) on sales growth of \(25 / 23 / 25\%\) for 2025/26/27E. We assume:

Net store openings of 300/350/400 in 2025/26/27E. Store- level operating profit margin (reported) at \(14.3\% /14.5\% /14.6\%\) in 2025/26/27E. Adj. EBITDA margin at \(12.1 / 12.4 / 12.9\%\) in 2025/26/27E Our DCF- based PT is HK\$118. This translates into \(69 / 50 / 35x\) \(25 / 26 / 27\) PEs (adj. EPS).

Top Material Issue(s): Food safety governance is most important for restaurant chains. DPC has established a WHSE working group, comprising CEO and other management members to meet monthly to oversee food safety practices. It has implemented a rigorous quality and safety system at every step of the food value chain, adhering to HACCP principles. DPC has also been phasing in sustainable packaging to replace nondegradable plastic packaging since 2021; the proportion of nonbiodegradable plastic packaging as a percentage of total packaging materials purchased has declined from \(6\%\) in 2020 to \(4\%\) in 2023.

Company target(s): (1) Annual waste reduction target: No more than \(0.1\%\) of loss rate of waste material in central kitchens versus purchase amounts. (2) Reduce generation of emissions and related pollution incidents during the manufacturing process.
to Mgmt: 1) How do you ensure food safety standards along the supply chain? 2) Restaurants are a service industry, and thus, the workforce's welfare is important. How do you retain your staff?
Lower- than- expected net store openings and sales per store. We assume:
Net store openings and SSsG are lower than expected. Store- level margin in new growth markets lower than expected. Intensified competition from other brands DCF- based PT is HK\$65.
SSsG momentum New store openings in new growth markets Effective cost control
Figure 1 - JEF forecast vs market consensus

Source: Bloomberg, Jefferies estimates EBIT here is not adjusted for lease liabilities interest to compare with Bloomberg numbers. Not all key brokers cover this name, and the company is still at a growth stage, so there may be some swings in market consensus profitability.
Figure 2 - Forecast change
Figure 3 - Key assumptions
Source: Company data, Jefferies estimates
\\*Note: It revised disclosure to include T1/non-T1 cities this time. The old classification is Beijing & Shanghai, and New growth markets' which included Guangzhou/Shenzhen before.
Figure 4-P&L as reported
Source: Company data, Jefferies estimates
Figure 5-Financials (current price at HK\$83.65)
Source: Company data, Jefferies estimates
We would like to thank Zhaochen Zhang, employee of Evaluerserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report.

DPC DashDPC Dash is the exclusive master franchisee of Domino's Pizza, a global handcrafted pizza company, in Mainland China, HK SAR, and Macau SAR. Its franchise agreement with Domino's Pizza lasts to 2027 and is subject to renewal at DPC Dash's option for 2 additional 10- year terms. The company started operations in 2010 and listed on the HKEX in 2023.

Our primary valuation methodology is DCF, employing a WACC of \(9.5\%\) , COE of \(9.5\%\) , beta of \(1x\) , and terminal growth rate of \(2.0\%\) (TGR is in line with our range of \(0 - 3\%\) for China consumer stocks). Industry risks include weak consumer sentiment, intensified market competition. Company risks include slower- than- expected store expansion, weaker- than- expected SSSg, unexpected cost hike, and food safety issues.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR)
Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise PicksJefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
DPC Dash Ltd (1405 HK: HK\$86.20, BUY)

Notes: Each box in the Rating and Price Target History chart above represents actions over the past three years in which an analyst initiated on a company, made a change to a rating or price target of a company or discontinued coverage of a company.
I: Initiating Coverage D: Dropped Coverage B: Buy H: Hold UP: Underperform
